comment_0:
This is a beautiful song. I love it a lot. He is the ONLY, and yes, ONLY rapper I will listen to. Because,

(a) His songs have meaning. They're not about sex and cars and bling blingin' rims.
(b) He has talent. He can actually rap. I don't think d12 is any good. =/

Anyway. I love this song and I'm getting his new CD right now... hehe.
-Sarah
comment_1:
I cant believe this song actually makes me cry, I dont know why.
Just the way some words are sung really hits something deep down inside of me. I feel so sorry for him.
comment_2:
Eminem has said publicly that he feels incredibly guilty that he hasn't been there for several important events in Hailie's life. He almost missed her first day of school because he was in rehab recently.

I believe he's saying that he is effectively "killing" Slim Shady because while Slim Shady made him famous and rich, now he wants that part of him to die so he can go back to being Marshall Mathers, father.

Awesome song and lyrics.
comment_3: Personally, i dont think eminem is retireing.  I think hes gonna be like all the older artists and take a break from singing for a while so he can watch hailie grow up.  Then hes going to come back and bite all our asses with a kickass song! lol
comment_4: What I get out of the song is that he's killing only Slim Shady, the part of him that started all of the controversies and created all the problems. If and when he breaks out another album, I think it will probably be all serious-set songs. I personally always liked the more serious songs. He'll be back.
comment_5:
I also want to congradulate Eminem on making a really great song. This is the only song that has ever made me cry!
"I walk right up to Kim and kiss her
Tell her I miss her
Hailie just smiles and winks at her little sister"

Does this mean Marshall is getting back with Kim? If he is, I hope Kim does'nt break his heart again, that would be fucked up.
comment_6: It's nice to see he can still put out decent records, after the horror of his 'Encore' album.
comment_7:
I think that this song shows how busy Eminem is, and how Hailie's more grown up now as his Eminem's past songs about Hailie she was only a very young child or a baby..
This also shows the "life" from Hailie's point of view too. I reckon that's cool. 
Yeh, I think this song is really great.
comment_8: Once again,another awesome song by eminem. They just don't stop coming.
comment_9: This is one of Slim's most sentimental and heartfelt songs. I am so happy for him that he actually got back with Kim.  After listening to the LP album, I never would have seen that coming in a 1000 years.  I love the metaphor, and how he kills himself and goes into a heaven with Hailie and Kim.  This song is destined to be a classic.
comment_10: This song is fantastic on so many levels -- there is real depth in the emotions that he is expressing. Eminem says he would "give an arm" for his daughter, and then castigates himself for abusing her mother, "who's the spittin image of her". While trying to give Hailie the life he never had, he deprives her of time with her father, becoming "the main source of her pain". In his nightmare, Haillie tells him it's too late, "go out there and show [the fans] that you love em more than us", i.e. that he's been lavishing the love that he should've been reserving for his family on his fans.  He symbolically suicides his Slim Shady persona, and awakens to a better life, with Kim and Haillie and Laney.
comment_11: i absolutely love this song. But i don't think he's gone forever. he's gunna sit back and be the dad he hasn't had the time to be.....for now anyway. then when hailie's older and we're all least expecting em's gunna come back and kick us all in the ass with a fuckin bangin song...outta nowhere. mind you, this is one of the few rappers i constantly listen to....i'm more into alternative and punk-rock....so yeah...but i love eminem more than any music i listen to. this seriously has to be one of his best songs...
comment_12:
This song is one of only a few I like by eminem, I do believe that he will be retiring. Even if he doesn't come back, he has made enough of an image to be remembered. 

This song was great, the lines are the most powerful I've ever heard in a rap. It makes you realise that although he is hardened to the world, he can be sensitive. I think he doesn't necessarily want to quit his rap career. I think he wants to kill the image that he has created...
comment_13:
i think what is going on in this song is that Eminem feels like he's been giving more love to his fans than to his own family.  So, he's telling us what he told them,
 "And when I'm gone 
  Just carry on 
  Don't mourn, rejoice everytime you hear the sound of my voice"
This is a kind of goodbye to his fans.  he's telling us to carry on and just be glad to hear his music when it comes because he's not gonna push himself anymore to write and tour constanly but he's going to do so when it comes to him.
personally, I believe the quality of his music will only improve if he makes this move.  No forced songs, just the naturally passionate music that makes him great.

comment_22: wow I think this is my favorite of his songs.  I think he's basicaly saying that Hailies growing up and she isn't gonna always keep forgiving him for not being there. comment_23: Eminem is so deep, many people under-estimate the meanings meant by him.  Despite his "absurd," to some people, lyrics, some sogns such as this one have a sweet and loving meaning and itention on his part.  He is telling his daughtoer that yes, he has made mistakes, but he loves her more than anything.  He wants the best for her and he wants her to know that her Daddy is always there for her.  He is a soldier and loves her.  I love the lyrics to this song.  They are sweet, genuine, and I honestly believe this is one of the many sides of Eminem- sincere and heart-felt.
comment_24: God, this song is incredible, as are all the songs Eminem's made that focus on his relationship with his daughter.  It's obvious he loves his daughter more than anything else in the world, and although he's had some problems, he wants to be there for her as much as possible.  I almost cry every time I listen to this, it's so moving.

I think that perhaps eminem maybe finally giving a hint to the roumers about his retirement, in this song.

"I turn around, find a gun on the ground

Once again another fantastic song by Eminem!

comment_33:
There are several laughable mistakes in the lyric transcrip abovet.

"But baby wasn't sweetin
How did you get this sweetin?"

should be

"But baby we're in Sweden.
How did you get to Sweden?"

(Keep in mind the scene takes place at a concert...)
------

"You rap about
Yeah word ke-keep it real"

should be

"You rap about
Yeah word, kid keep it real"

As for the meaning of the song, I love it. And I traditionally haven't even really enjoyed Eminem's music.  But this song is self indictment of both his admittedly hubristic career and how he put too much weight on his career and in the process failed as a father.

Good stuff. Great rhythm to the lyrics too.

Emienm and Marshall Mathers are still going to rap. Slim Shady is not. If you have listened to Eminem for a while you know that he has different styles of rapping. Slim Shady is the rap about his mom and wife and killing them both. They didn't cause problems because of the lyrics, but because he was always bus writing and on tour he didn't see hte touble he was causing his daughter. He is now realizng that and he is taing a break. He is back with Kim and they are getting married really soon. This song is my favorite ever.

comment_61:
Eminem always shows his hate for his mom and kim in his Shady style. I'm not convinced any of the stuff he raps about is real, I think he just was trying to make it in the business and it made for an intriguing story. Throughout his cds, Em basically raps about his whole life, which is really ingenius if you think about it, would people listen to a song about your 'life?'
As soon as the cd was released he announced that he got back with Kim. When I'm Gone is saying good bye to Slim Shady, and he's sorry to both Kim and Hailey for the trouble he caused. As many of you know that the rap industry has a lot of murders and the lyrics to the song "And I didn't feel a thing so baby, don't feel no pain" I think he wrote this in case he was ever murdered, his family would know that he was died peacefully and quickly. Now I'm not saying thats the reason, just if he ever was assassinated you could go back to this song.

Another thing was that he saw the hate he had for Kim in his songs, but noticed the essential love of his life (Hailey) was turning into a "spitting image of her" and I think he maybe thought it was time to made ammends with Kim.

comment_66:
By the way, if the only rapper you listen to is Eminem, you are definitely a white person who has no understanding of hip-hop/rap. Thank you for your patience. Now I'll cut to the chase. In my opinion, Eminem is probably one of the most overrated rappers of all time, seriously. But then again, so is everyone else who has even a small amount of talent in this gangsta rap wasteland. (Jay-Z, Tupac, and B.I.G) So naturally, since Em is more talented than most rappers, becomes big. (And it actually helps that he's white, because he's gained quite a following with cultureless caucasians, whether he likes it or not.) But this doesn't mean he can't have a few good songs. Well this is one of them. This is one of the few rap songs out there that really reflects the artist's soul, with its beats, lyrics, and energy. This, Slim Shady, and Lose Yourself are the only good Eminem songs out there. The others don't live up to those. 

Oh, and by the way if you want to hear hip-hop/rap with ACTUAL meaning to it, you might want to listen to Gorillaz (Dirty Harry, Feel Good Inc., Clint Eastwood, etc.), Will Smith (First Rap Grammy, nuff said'[get Lost & Found]), or Kanye West (Diamonds From Sierra Leone Remix w/ Jay-Z, Jesus Walks, Hey Mama) who have stronger messages and lots of great songs.

comment_97:
I turn around, find a gun on the ground
Cock it, put it to my brain
Scream Die Shady!, and pop it
The sky darkens
My life flashes
This is Eminem killing his alter ego Slim Shady. Thats why he says Die Shady and not Die Marshal. He sees his life flashing before him and realizes that he would have died if it wasn't for him leaving and going home early. He finally realizes after all those years of missing out on Hailies life that, that is were he was suppose to be the whole time not on stage but with his family.

This whole song is for his daughter not his fans. He loves his daughter and this is like his message that will forever be known by everyone. Not just his daughter. He is telling the world that he is and will stay a changed man even if it means giving up on his career as a rapper.
comment_98:
Throughout this song Eminem tells us how hard his life is as a parent and a singer. Eminem starts the song by directly describing the way his life is, and how he truly feels about it. The theme is about how the love of a dad hasnât truly been found, and is needed. Eminem doesnât enjoy leaving Hailie to go perform, but instead he wants her to understand his departures. Eminem isnât the best father, and isnât always there for Hailie but he truly does love her. In a many different lines he has stated how he would do anything for Hailie including give his life for her. 

In verse 2 Eminem describes everything that is going on with his daughter. Hailie says:
                  âYouâre making Mommy cry, why? Why is Mommy crying?â
		Baby, Daddy ainât leaving no more, âDaddy youâre lying
		You always say that, you always say this is the last time 
		But you ainât leaving no more, Daddy your mineâ
                  Sheâs piling boxes in front of the door trying to block it
                  âDaddy please, Daddy donât leave, Daddy no â stop it!â

This scene describes how much Hailie hates when her dad leaves, and shows how desperately she was trying to convince him to stay with her. According to the line âYou always say that, you always say this is the last timeâ, this wasnât the first time that Eminem had left her. Eminem tried convincing Hailie that he was going to come back to make her feel better but she had already noticed his lies. All Hailie wanted was to spend time with her dad! Even though Eminem wanted to be both things, a singer and a good father for her. It was a hard decision for him.

comment_102: It means that his family doesn't want him to leave again, like when he goes on tour, and his daughter knew that he was lying when he said he wouldn't leave.  It also means that he loves his family, but he keeps leaving to perform and it hurts them.
comment_103: I remember the first time I actually really listened to this song. It was in the end of 2011, around school time and one weekend my parents and I decided to go out and buy some paint for my room; blue paint. We were in the car on a sunday, and I was listening to music on my phone, and this song came up. For some reason, I was feeling kind of down. The words, and the actual music; it's just like bliss. Even though I see my Dad every day, and I live with both of my parents, and I know that this song has a obvious meaning but to me, I see it like this. It could be about any person preparing their loved ones, or friends for when they leave. Either for a short moment, or forever. It's like Eminem been through every single feeling that I ever felt. When I just want to be alone, he always understands.
comment_104: I love the irony.  This song itself clearly took time to write, time Eminem could've spent with his kids.  But the point is that he chose to write the song instead.
